Title: RHSA-2019:3651: sssd security, bug fix, and enhancement update (Low)
Description:
The System Security Services Daemon (SSSD) service provides a set of daemons to manage access to remote directories and authentication mechanisms. It also provides the Name Service Switch (NSS) and the Pluggable Authentication Modules (PAM) interfaces toward the system, and a pluggable back-end system to connect to multiple different account sources.

The following packages have been upgraded to a later upstream version: sssd (2.2.0). (BZ#1687281)

Security Fix(es):

* sssd: improper implementation of GPOs due to too restrictive permissions (CVE-2018-16838)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.1 Release Notes linked from the References section.

Bugzillas.Title: sssd failover does not work on connecting to non-responsive ldaps:// server
Attributes not present in Global Catalog can be removed from the cache during GC lookups
sssctl user-checks does not show custom IFP user_attributes
CVE-2018-16838 sssd: improper implementation of GPOs due to too restrictive permissions
Error accessing files on samba share randomly
responders chain requests that were issued before reconnection to sssd_be
sss_cache prints spurious error messages when invoked from shadow-utils on package install
SSSD netgroups do not honor entry_cache_nowait_percentage
proxy provider is not working with enumerate=true when trying to fetch all groups
Missing sssd-files in last section(SEE ALSO) of sssd man pages
crash when requesting extra attributes
MAN: Document that PAM stack contains the systemd-user service in the account phase in RHEL-8
sssd man pages: The default value of  "ldap_user_home_directory" is not mentioned with AD server configuration
pam_sss with smartcard auth does not create gnome keyring
sssd config-check reports an error for a valid configuration option
AD user not found after establishing trust and restarting sssd
sudorule matching when no host or hostcat set
Rebase sssd in RHEL-8.1 to the latest upstream release
sssd service is starting before network service
Extend cached_auth_timeout to cover subdomains / trusts
[RFE] return multiple server addresses to the Kerberos locator plugin
TPS tests fail for sssd-common in RHEL 8 (rpm -V sssd-common)
p11_child::sign_data() function implementation is not FIPS140 compliant
Old kerberos credentials active instead of valid new ones (kcm)
sssd-proxy crashes resolving groups with no members
negative cache does not use values from 'filter_users' config option for known domains
sssd does not pass correct rules to sudo
permission denied on logs when running sssd as non-root user
Smart Card auth of local user: endless loop if wrong PIN was provided
Sudo prompt for smart card authentication is missing the trailing colon
sssd config option "default_domain_suffix" should not cause files domain entries to be qualified, this can break sudo access
dyndns_update = True is no longer enough to get the IP address of the machine updated in IPA upon sssd.service startup
